meanings.definition: The soft underside or belly of an animal.
meanings.sent1: The puppy's underbellies were warm and fluffy.
meanings.sent2: The cat stretched out, exposing its underbellies to the sun.
meanings.sent3: The underbellies of the piglets wiggled as they played in the mud.
meanings.sent4: The underbellies of the clouds glowed pink in the sunset.
meanings.sent5: Children love to tickle the underbellies of their pets.

meanings.definition: The hidden or vulnerable part of something.
meanings.sent1: The underbellies of the plan were revealed during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: She felt a shiver in the underbellies of her heart.
meanings.sent3: The underbellies of the mystery novel kept the readers guessing until the end.
meanings.sent4: The underbellies of the city's corruption were finally exposed by the journalist.
meanings.sent5: The underbellies of the iceberg were much larger than what was visible above water.
